sp.p: 'Twill then be beſt to wait his coming— hark— (A cry without)

sp.speaker: CLARISA.
sp.p: My father—ſure 'tis my father's voice.

sp.speaker: CLARISA.
sp.p: O my father.

sp.speaker: HARTLY.
sp.p: No time—too precious, ſir, to be loſt.— Your daughter—ſir, gueſs the whole—my tongue would faulter at ſo baſe a tale—

sp.speaker: DOCTOR.
sp.p: And mine faulters now ſo I can't ſpeak a ſingle word.

sp.speaker: COLONEL.
sp.p: Where is the wretch?

sp.speaker: HARTLY.
sp.p:
He'll ſoon return—Doctor, go find an officer, at once, (Exit Doctor.) Cloſe the door,
leſt he miſtruſt—for he will ſoon be here— ſtand ready to ſeize him and others if there are—let us blow out the light we'll then be ſure to catch him.

div.stage: (Haven and Samuel open the door ſoftly and enter—Colonel and Hartly ſeize them, and with Punctum hold them faſt.)

sp.speaker: COLONEL.
sp.p: Who are you? Tell me who you are.

sp.speaker: HAVEN.
sp.p: Let me alone—I'll not tell you who I am.

sp.speaker: COLONEL.
sp.p: Tell me who you are.

sp.speaker: HAVEN.
sp.p: Let me alone, I'll not tell you who I am.

sp.speaker: COLONEL.
sp.p: Ay ſtruggle—you're grappled by an arm that will hold you faſt till you're delivered to the ſheriff's hands.

sp.speaker: HAVEN.
sp.p: Sam, where are you?

sp.speaker: SAMUEL.
sp.p: In juſt ſuch a box as yourſelf, only it takes two to hold me.

sp.speaker: HAVEN.
sp.p: Good Lord—A ſheriff's coming.

sp.speaker: COLONEL.
sp.p: Are you a ſheriff?

sp.speaker: SHERIFF.
sp.p: Ay, a deputy ſheriff, ſir, I am.

sp.speaker: COLONEL.
sp.p: Here, take theſe fellows under your care— Let them not go, upon your peril—I'll have a mittimus in half an hour. (Exit Colonel.)

sp.speaker: DOCTOR.
sp.p: Now you're ſafe, you dogs—Miſs Clara, do you know me? I am Doctor Hoaks—a phyſician and ſurgeon—and I believe you're the ſame Lady that is in love with me—'Tis I that got this ſheriff—tis I that found out where you was—all I.

sp.speaker: HAVEN.
sp.p: Oh don't carry us to goal—oh don't.

sp.speaker: SHERIFF.
sp.p: If you have done no ill, you will be recompenſed for all your troubles—If crimes are alledged againſt you, and are proved, then you need fear a goal, and more a court of juſtice.

sp.speaker: CLARISA.
sp.p: But Oh—what court of juſtice can do juſtice to me?

sp.speaker: HAVEN.
sp.p: Oh madam, can you forgive me—forgive me—I'll grant this hand—the hand of wealth and reputation.

sp.speaker: CLARISA.
sp.p: I diſdain the hand, the head, the heart— If ſuch a wretch as you have wealth and reputation, no honeſt woman would except of them. (Enter Colonel.)

sp.speaker: COLONEL.
sp.p: Wretch—ſoon ſhall the ſtrong goal contain that curſed heart—and if there be force in the laws of this commonwealth—ere long, I'll ſee your carcaſe ſwinging in the air—tied to an honeſt rope—Are there not proſtitutes enough in this town to ſatisfy your baſe unbridled paſſions?

sp.speaker: HAVEN.
sp.p: I've offered to marry her.

sp.speaker: COLONEL.
sp.p: I'd rather marry her to that ſimple Doctor, who well deſerves my thanks for his aſſiſtance in detecting you.

sp.speaker: DOCTOR.
sp.p: You call me ſimple, ſir—I compound all my medicines.

sp.speaker: COLONEL.
sp.p: Here are two crowns for your trouble, Doctor, I believe we ſhall have no more need of your aſſiſtance.

sp.speaker: DOCTOR.
sp.p: Ah well—this will do as well as a wife, till it's ſpent—but do get that man hanged.

sp.speaker: HAVEN,
sp.p: Ah but forgive me—I'll wear out years in prayers and penitence—I'll be your bound ſlave during life.

sp.speaker: COLONEL.
sp.p:
Not one year can you have for prayers and penitence—uſe well the few remaining days of life—there's no repentance in the grave—you plead for mercy—ſhall one eyed mercy browbeat the honeſt claims of juſtice, and ſave that devil for whom the gallows waits—You robbed me of my joys—my daughter of her virgin purity—and you ſhall die—your aſſociate—and your landlord, ſhall feel the vengeance of the law. This handkerchief betrays your name at full—I know your character—The goaler'll ſoon be here to drag you to the houſe appointed
for the authors of crimes like yours.

sp.speaker: COL. FARSTER.
sp.p: Here take this villain; who has ſo long defrauded the goal of its juſt dues,

sp.speaker: HAVEN.
sp.l: O GOD of mercy! hear my prayer!
And when I ſtand before the bar of Heaven,
Oh may my vile offences be forgiven.
